data.title: The Christian Athlete: My Story
data.meta_description: The Christian Athlete: My Story IS HEARD EACH WEEK ON SELECT RADIO STATIONS ON THE GOLDEN WEST RADIO NETWORK Join these athletes as they share their personal story for trusting Jesus Christ as their personal Saviour.
data.text:
Do You Know Jesus?

Here is an athlete that does . . .

Click the PLAY button to listen to the interview

If the player above doesn't play please click the PLAY button below

Michael's Biography

Born: Feb. 22, 1972 – Hoboken, New Jersey

College:

Biola University, Masters in Ministry

Turned Professional: ATP, 1988

Grand Slam Record

French Open - Singles Champion, 1989

Youngest male Grand Slam winner, 17 years 110 days; defeated Stefan Edberg

French Open – Runner-up, 1995

Australian Open: - Runner-up 1996

United States Open - Runner-up, 1996

Career Achievements

U.S. Davis Cup Team Member 1989-90, 1996-97

Career Record: 662 – 312

Career Titles: 34

Highest Ranking: No. 2, 1996

Inducted: International Tennis Hall of Fame, 2008.

Author: Holding Serve: Persevering On and Off the Court. 2002

Chang Family Foundation

The Chang Family Foundation (CFF) was established (1999) to introduce the Good News of Jesus Christ to the world through local community and international programs.

Be sure to join us each week as more athletes from the world of sport

join us to share their personal testimony.

It's been several years since this program's co-host Barry Sharpe has gone to be with the Lord...as was his wish, we continue to faithfully air this program... If you enjoy listening, would you please let us know?…just a quick text or phone message to 1-604-220-8254
